revised_title: On the Relative Power of Various Substances in Preventing Putrefaction and the Development of Protoplasmic and Fungus-Life
tldr: Dr. F. Crace-Calvert investigates the effectiveness of various substances in preventing putrefaction and the development of protoplasmic and fungus-life. He finds that carbolic and cresylic acids are the most effective in preventing the growth of both types of life, while other substances have varying degrees of success in inhibiting the development of microorganisms.
